I have four days left to live.  I'm quite excited for everything to come to fruition after many years of fear and uncertainty. I have a tumor wrapped around my brain stem that I haven't told anyone close to me about, there is no hope, and nothing could be done. Six months ago I was told I had two months left. I can feel myself getting weaker, confused, spacey, shaking. I feel the fear gripping me again.  This tumor would have killed me regardless and I'm choosing to go on my own terms. Why now? My 15 year old boxer finally kicked the bucket and I wanted to be there for her. I got her when I was 13, she was my first pet and now my last. She had cancer, too, she crossed the rainbow bridge Monday. I have spent the last week with my mom and dad cleaning up their hoard, I'm very happy I gave them a clean living space to mourn in. I called my daughter and her mother and told them that I was sending them an early birthday present for my girl and sent my ex my last paycheck saying I got a bonus and just wanted to get a jump on support. Neither will miss me. I have rented a cabin this weekend for a couple of friends and myself. I've got enough drugs and booze to give them the best time they've had in a long time.  Saturday night I will over drink and finish whatever I have left of my pain medication. My friends will think I died how I lived: happy and surrounded with people that love me. It's been real for the last 13 or so years with you /b/ros, wish me luck in the next stage of my adventure.

For the corporate media scrolling through /b/ (again) because of the Leslie Jones hack, you should know that it didn't used to be like this. There was a time when /b/ was subversive and anarchic, but not mean and petty. The racism you saw on /b/ was intended to be ironic. Then Anonymous happened and the feds forced m00t to nerf 4chan or get all his servers seized. Having zero spine, m00t kicked off all the subversives and a bunch of teenaged middle-schoolers took their place. They were too stupid to recognize irony, so the racism around here became real. Then a bunch of neo-Nazi white supremacists from Stormfront realized they had a potential audience of impressionable, low-IQ teenyboppers and they invaded 4chan in earnest. What you see now is the result: ugly, mean, racist, sexist, and stupid. I just want you folks in the corporate media to understand that it wasn't always this way. Those of us who have been on 4chan since the very beginning remember when things were quite different. /b/ was never good, but there was a time it was a force for subversion rather than just right-wing authoritarianism and Dunning-Kruger ignorance. If fellow oldfags could bump this for a while so the corporate media has a chance to see this, I'd appreciate it.

I want to be alone Now before you call me edgy and think I'm trying to be some kind of cool faggot, I want to say that I really do love other people, in a weird way. I want everyone to have the same freedom for peace, or whatever the hell it is they want. I don't hate anyone at all. But, I want to be alone. People stress me out and annoy me, and I don't like being around them at all. I wish I could live in islotaion, where I would have no one but myself to worry about. I enjoy being by myself, I find it relaxing and comforting. I never really gained anything from social contact besides frustration, embarassment, and annoying other people.  I'm saying all this because, unfortunately, in this world it is very hard to be alone. At one point you could probably just run off and leave other people, because societies were small as shit. But now, you're born right in the middle of a massive structure that the only way out, is to work in it, but once you're working in it you can't leave. Warning: The following story has been known to make atheists cry! An atheist went to the zoo with his 5 year old son. In his hand he held a Bible. When they reached the chimp exhibit, the atheist said to his son "Look at the chimpanzees. See how similar they are to us? That's because we have a common ancestor, son. Evolution is true and God is not." The atheist tore a page out of the Bible and threw it into the chimp exhibit. A chimp quickly swung over to the Bible page and ate it. "See how the chimp ate that Bible page? If God really existed, he wouldn't have allowed the chimp to eat it." The atheist and his son continued to visit ever animal exhibit, and the atheist father did the same thing at each and every one. Finally, only one page of the Bible remained and only one animal remained to be visited. They came up to the aquarium where a big octopus was laying on a rock. The atheist ripped out the last Bible page and dropped it into the aquarium. Suddenly, the octopus grabbed the Bible page and began to come up, out of the water! The atheist and boy were so surprised their mouths fell agape! The octopus looked the father in the eye, and with an inhuman voice began to read from the page! " Psalm 14:1! The fool hath said in his heart," There is no God!" The atheist stood there, speechless! The octopus began to speak again "Do you think that because we animals ate pages of the Bible, it means that God is not real? Look how much of a fool you are! Do you not know that the Word of God is nourishment to all who partake of it! You fool!". The atheist dropped to his knees and began to cry. The octopus spoke again "Accept Christ, and your sins will be absolved, sinner". With a tear-stained face, the atheist said in a shaking voice: "I do! I accept Christ and God and the Holy Spirit! I was such a fool for not believing!". The former-atheist did the sign of the cross and stood up. His knees were still shaking but a bright glow surrounded him as he converted to Christianity.

**Think pumpkin spice is harmless? Think again.** "We were as surprised as everyone else," wrote molecular biologist Dr. Hannah Beck in her upcoming feature in the journal Nature. "It's very popular, and all of the ingredients are currently FDA approved." "I got suspicious when one of my lab assistants underestimated the size of her belly and knocked a rack of test tubes to the floor. Most of these kids are 22, 23, 24 years old. They shouldn't be growing so quickly that it affects their coordination, and that's when I remembered that she always had a pumpkin spice latte in the morning. Those things are full of sugar, but only a few hundred extra calories couldn't explain the massive changes in body weight and composition we were seeing." Animal trials began in January of 2015 and concluded one month ago. According to Dr. Beck's upcoming paper, mice who were given free access to food that had been flavored with pumpkin spice gained 76% more weight compared to mice who were given free access to either unflavored food or food flavored with cocoa powder (p&lt;0.01). "It's not about the amount they're consuming," she clarified. "All groups consumed approximately the same mass of food pellets. Something in the pumpkin spice mixture is actively interfering with their metabolism, causing lethargy and increased conversion of blood sugar into fat." Dr. Beck and her team are currently investigating the use of pumpkin spice in the treatment of dangerously underweight individuals. You can read more about it in the October 2016 issue of Nature.

Just venting to /b/ cause i don't want to vent where I will be judged. A few months ago my friend died. Too keep things anonymous we are going to call my friend Jeff. Jeff's death was unexpected to say the least, he was only 17. We don't live in the safest part of town and he was shot like an animal, he didn't deserve that,he deserved more out of life. Nobody knows who the shooter. We don't know if the shooter had a personal thing with Jeff (which is unlikely considering Jeff has never hurt anybody previously). Jeff and I have been friends for a bit until his death and when my mom told me at the dinner table I was shocked. It hurts because of how much that moment sticks with me and how much detail I remember when I finally realized my only friend died that day. Jeff and I were never really that popular, he was an orphan who was not with his parents for long until he moved until his foster home. He didn't like speaking to others and neither did I. We were often made fun of by the other kids, mostly on our looks and Jeff's way of speaking (he was not the best at speaking therefor avoided conversation). I had Jeff and Jeff had me. Jeff was everything for me, he was a role model and a friend. After Jeff's death people that probably didn't even know he existed before his death were flocking to social media about how much they cared about Jeff. People who have bullied us are praising Jeff and saying he will be missed. After a while people jumped on the hype train and now everyone is pretending like they cared when they didnt know he existed the day before his death. Dont get me wrong its great seeing the support Jeff is getting but i HATE how people are using this as an excuse to get attention and to show that they cared when really, they don't. I've missed every moment without Jeff. Now everyone is saying bs like "Dicks out for Jeff" and "Jeff died for our prayers". Remember my friend, Died May 27th 2016, at the Cincinnati zoo, Remember him.

Human beings will be extinct in 200 years. Approximately 40% of all manmade CO2 is successfully absorbed by the environment. This means roughly 60% of manmade CO2 is not absorbed and thus increases atmospheric CO2. We may therefore say we need to reduce global CO2 production by around 60% to reach a break even point - but this ignores the fact that absorption rises along with our production. Still, something around this number can be found in the scientific research. "In order to stabilize CO2 concentrations at about 450 ppm by 2050, global emissions would have to decline by about 60%. Industrialized countries greenhouse gas emissions would have to decline by about 80%." -Barack Obama's Presidential Climate Action Plan 80% - And all our proposed plans (if fully executed) would reduce emissions by less than 5%. The United States accounts for about 17% of manmade CO2. Japan, 4%. Korea, 2%. European nations between 1 and 2 percent each. China and the developing world account for over 47% of manmade CO2. So if you wiped out all of the US, all of Europe, Japan, and Korea, and then managed to reduce China by around 25%, you would be near the break even point for CO2 absorption. Perhaps you start to see now what we are actually facing here. A 60% global reduction in CO2 cannot be accomplished without creating a worldwide economic depression which would no doubt kill millions of human beings. Good luck on reversing the industrial revolution and sending mankind back to the stone age. It will never happen in this world driven by profit.

I like people for the most part, their interesting and sometimes challenging to my world view and I love those conversations. But this is the minority of human interaction. It's more important to many to know the gossip or trend or illusion of righteousness then to self-absorb. I don't want to be on the outside, anymore. I don't care if I'm right or wrong I just want to be relevant.
